comments.text:
Actually, you also have to assume that any shorts are not fanon... I would 
assume that most of them are clones, because there is the possibility that 
gru created them, but the trailer for minions kinda makes it canon. Shorts 
are usually just fun little things. It is possible that they messed up, but 
like i said, because shorts are not technically canon, you cant assume the 
short is the correct one.
comments.author: Eric Zorath

comments.text:
I believe that it was somewhat established in the Minion short called 
"Orientation Day" when the new minions had to watch an instructional film 
reel of their jobs. At the end of the reel, the announcer stated "We're not 
just coworkers, we're family...After all, we are ALL ENGINEERED from the 
same strand of dna."

There are two ways to take that, IMO.
One: They were, indeed ALL created by Gru, or two: There were only a small 
amount that actually existed and for Gru to get the numbers of minions he 
wanted, he used the originals' dna to make more copies. Perhaps the minions 
with actual names given are the original ones and the rest are their carbon 
copies. Just thinking outside the box there. Either way, it seems to tack 
on the idea that they were not pre existing before Gru as the new trailer 
has suggested they did.
comments.author: blackkatt777

comments.text:
they never actually stated that fact... they just, existed... so the carbon 
copy is fanon, and shouldnt bother anyone... fanon is what fans hope for, 
but canon is what is the truth, this makes those theories null and void

top_comment.text:
Pierre Coffin and Chris Renaud are the voices of the minions in all of the 
movies. 
Here is the language translations. Some of the words are actual words from 
foreign languages like Spanish, Korean, Chinese, and Filipino. Yes it took 
a long time to type.

Minion Language               English Translation
Bello!                                      Hello!
Poopaye!                                Goodbye!
Tank yu!                                 Thank you!
Me want banana!                     I'm hungry!
Bananonina!                            Ugly!
Underwear                               I swear
Bee Do Bee Do Bee Do!           Fire!
Tulaliloo ti amo!                       We love you!
Tatata bala tu!                         I hate you!
Baboi                                     Toy
Po ka                                     What
Bable                                     Apple
Gelato                                    Ice cream
Butt                                        Butt
Hana                                      One
Dul                                         Two
Sae                                        Three
Para tu                                    For you
Chasy                                     Chair
Kan pai                                   Cheers!
Pwede na                                Can we start?
Luk at tu!                                Look at you!
Muak Muak Muak                    Kiss kiss
Bi do                                       I'm sorry
La Boda                                  Marriage
Buttom                                    Bottom
Stupa! Stupa!                          Stop! Stop!
Sa la ka!                                 How dare you!﻿

to these minions. A while back in Korea McDonalds gave out Minions with 
their kids' meal, and people in their 20s and 30s camped out in front of 
McDonalds. I can see the same, if not more extreme, thing happening in 
Japan too.

captions.text: Minions have been on this planet far longer than we have.
They all share the same goal.
To serve the most despicable master around.
Well that's where things got TRICKY.
But nonetheless, they kept on looking.
Without a master, they had no purpose.
If this went on much longer...
But then, one minion stepped forward!
Kevin felt pride!  He was going to be the one to find his tribe the biggest, baddest villain to serve!
He was going to be the one to eat this banana.
Bob was frightened of the journey ahead.

title: Minions 2015 Official Trailer + Trailer Review : Beyond The Trailer
